property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunedain. Ranger. Noble.

property.name: Text
property.value: The first player gains control of Aragorn. If Aragorn leaves play, the players lose the game. While Aragorn has an Artifact attached to him, he gains sentinel and does not exhaust to quest.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Rohan. Noble.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Reduce your threat by 3. Action: Raise your threat by 3 to ready Éowyn. She gets +9 Û until the end of the phase. (Limit once per game for the group.)

property.name: Traits
property.value: Gondor. Warrior.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Sentinel.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Beregond defends an attack and takes no damage, reduce the defending player’s threat by 1. (Limit once per round.)

property.name: Traits
property.value: Rohan. Warrior.

property.name: Text
property.value: Combat Action: Discard Grimbold to choose an enemy engaged with a player. That enemy cannot attack that player this phase.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Gondor. Noble.

property.name: Text
property.value: While there is a hero card in your discard pile, Prince Imrahil loses the ally card type and gains the hero card type.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunedain. Ranger.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reduce the cost to play Halbarad by 1 for each enemy engaged with you. Each enemy engaged with you gets +10 engagement cost.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Wose.

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the $ of the active location. Travel Action: Discard Ghân-buri-Ghân to travel to a location without resolving its Travel cost.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: Exhaust a Weapon or Armor card attached to the defending character to cancel a shadow effect just triggered in combat.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After a sentinel character is declared as a defender, it gets +2 Ú for this attack. If this attack deals no damage, ready the defending character.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Armor.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero is declared as a defender, exhaust Golden Shield to add attached hero’s Ò to its Ú for this attack.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Armor.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Gondor hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: Spend X resource from attached hero’s pool to cancel X damage just dealt to attached hero.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Mount.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to a Dunedain hero. If attached hero is Aragorn, he gains the Ï icon. Response: After you optionally engage an enemy, exhaust Roheryn and attached hero to declare that hero as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Artifact. Item.

property.name: Text
property.value: Attach to Aragorn. While Aragorn is questing, each other questing character you control gets +1 Ò. While Aragorn is attacking, each other attacking character you control gets +1 Û.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Title.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Permanent.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Rohan trait. Attached hero gets +1 Û while attacking with another Rohan character.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Title.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Permanent.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gains the Gondor trait. Attached hero gets +1 Ò while committed to the quest with another Gondor character.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Fear.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Attach to your threat dial. Limit 1 per threat dial. Your threat cannot be reduced. Forced: At the end of the round, raise your threat by 1. Then, you may spend 1 ☺ resource to detach Overcome by Fear and set it aside, out of play.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Hill.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. Forced: After The Stone of Erech becomes the active location, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Travel: Remove 5 progress from stage 3B to travel here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Underground.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Dark Door is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area. Travel: The first player reveals an encounter card to travel here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Underground.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Trysting Place is in the staging area, each enemy in the staging area cannot take damage. Travel: The first player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an Oathbreaker enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Underground.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Deadly Road is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: After a ‘when revealed’ effect is canceled, raise each player’s threat by 1.” Travel: Spend 1 ☺ resource to travel here.

property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Underground.

property.name: Text

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Either raise your threat by 2, or return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.

property.name: Shadow

property.name: Traits
property.value: Ship.

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the number of resources on The Corsiar Fleet. The players cannot travel here unless there are at least 3 Ship locations in the victory display. Travel: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Corsair enemy and adds it to the staging area. One of those enemies must be Corsair Captain, if able.

property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Traits
property.value: Ship.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Umbar War Galley is the active location, each Corsair enemy gets -10 engagement cost. Travel: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a Corsair enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

property.name: Traits

property.value: When Revealed: Each Ship location in the staging area gets +1 $. If there are no non-unique Ship locations in the staging area, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Ship location and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Gondor. City Minas Tirith has 30 hit points plus 10 for each player. Forced: At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to Minas Tirith for each enemy in the staging area. Then, if Minas Tirith has no hit points remaining, the players lose the game.

property.name: Traits

property.name: Text

property.name: Traits
property.value: Nazgul. Mordor.

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Add Wraith on Wings to the staging area. Cannot have non-Morgul attachments. Wraith on Wings gets +1 $ and -1 engagement cost for each resource on it. (Limit 5.) Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, place 1 resource on Wraith on Wings.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set The Stone of Erech and Army of the Dead aside, out of play. Each player attaches a copy of Overcome by Fear to his threat dial. Remove each unattached copy of Overcome by Fear from the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player may add 1 resource to the resource pool of each hero he controls. Each player who does so must raise his threat by 3. Forced: At the end of the planning phase, discard all cards in each player’s hand and advance to stage 2A.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a different location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the threat of the player with the highest threat. Each player cannot reduce his threat below his initial threat level. Forced: At the beginning of the planning phase each player must choose: either raise your threat by 1, or you cannot play cards this phase.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Add The Stone of Erech and Army of the Dead (enemy side faceup) to the staging area. Each player may raise his threat by 3 to detach Overcome by Fear from his threat dial and set it aside, out of play.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: While Stone of Erech is the active location, each Oathbreaker enemy loses the Phantom keyword and gets -20 engagement cost. When The Stone of Erech leaves play as an explored location, the players win the game.

card.name: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: The Lord of the Rings Part 13

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Each player may change heroes without incurring the +1 threat penalty. The first player may raise each player's threat by 1 to search his deck for Andúril and add it to his hand. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck:

alternate.name: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Text
property.value: Resolution: Add each copy of Overcome by Fear attached to a player's threat dial to the campaign pool and record the name of each player it was attached to. If Army of the Dead is in the victory display, add the Army of the Dead boon to the campaign pool. The players have earned each card added to the campaign pool.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Traits
property.value: Undead. Oathbreaker.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. X is twice the number of players in the game. Forced: When Army of the Dead attacks, you must either attach a set aside Overcome by Fear to your threat dial, or discard an ally you control.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. The first player gains control of Army of the Dead. If Army of the Dead leaves play, remove it from the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Add The Corsair Fleet (Corsair side faceup) and Great Corsair Ship to the staging area. Each player searches the encounter deck for a Ship location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Text
property.value: Each Ship location in the staging area is immune to player card effects. The players cannot defeat this stage while Great Corsair Ship is in play. When this stage is defeated, the players win the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Traits
property.value: The Lord of the Rings Part 14

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: The first player may raise each player's threat by 1 to search his deck for Anduril and add it to his hand. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck:

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Text
property.value: Resolution: Count the number of resources on The Corsair Fleet and record that number in the notes section of the quest log. Remove Army of the Dead from the campaign pool.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Siege of Gondor

property.name: Traits
property.value: Corsair.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, place 1 resource on this objective. Then, each player must choose: either reveal an encounter card, or assign X damage among characters he controls. X is the number of resources on this objective. ...ships of great draught with many oars, and with black sails bellying in the breeze. -The Return of the King

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, remove 1 resource from The Corsair Fleet. Then, if there are no resources here, the first player takes control of Aragorn and adds The Corsair Fleet to the victory display.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set Minas Tirith, Grond, The Witch-king, and each copy of Wraith on Wings aside, out of play. Search the encounter deck for a copy of Pelennor Field and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck. The players may attach Esquire of Rohan and Esquire of Gondor to different heroes.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Skip the quest phase and combat phase. Forced: At the end of the planning phase, place 1 progress here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player adds 1 set aside Wraith on Wings to the staging area and reveals an encounter card. Starting with the first player, each player discards cards from the top of his deck until he discards an ally that is not in play. Put the discarded ally into play in the staging area and treat its text box as if it were blank until the end of the phase.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: X is the total cost of each ally in the staging area. Allies in the staging area are treated as if their text box is blank, are immune to player card effects, and are under no player’s control. Forced: At the end of the round, assign damage among allies in the staging area equal to the number of enemies in the staging area.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player takes control of each ally he owns in the staging area and exhausts it. The first player adds Minas Tirith, Grond, and The Witch-king (Captain side faceup) to the staging area. Each other player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a different enemy and adds it to the staging area.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Assault. The White City Besieged gets +4 quest points for each player. The players cannot travel to Pelennor locations. Forced: When an enemy is destroyed, place progress on this stage equal to its total $ (progress must be placed on any active location first).

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Set The Witch-king aside, out of play. Each player searches the top 10 cards of his deck for an ally that matches the sphere of a hero he controls and puts it into play under his control. Each player shuffles his deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Progress that would be placed on this stage by questing successfully is instead assigned as damage among enemies in play. (Progress must be placed on the active location first.) Forced: At the end of the quest phase, advance to stage 5A.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: The first player adds The Witch-king to the staging area (Sorcerer side faceup). Then, he searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Fell Beast and attaches it to The Witch-king, if able. Each other player reveals an encounter card.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: The Witch-king and encounter cards dealt to The Witch-king are immune to player card effects. Forced: When an enemy attacks and destroys a character, deal 1 damage to Minas Tirith. The players cannot defeat this stage unless Aragorn is in play and The Witch-king is in the victory display. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

card.name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Traits
property.value: The Lord of the Rings Part 15

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set each Harad enemy recorded in the campaign log aside, out of play. The first player attaches Andúril and Banner of Elendil to Aragorn and sets him aside, out of play. Add The Corsair Fleet to the staging area (Gondor side faceup) and place X resources on it, where X is the number recorded in the campaign log. Remove each burden with the following burden set icons from the encounter deck, then flip this card over:

alternate.name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: When the players advance to stage 5B, add each set aside Harad enemy to the staging area. Resolution: Add 1 copy, per player, of Wraith on Wings to the campaign pool. The players have earned those burdens. If Esquire of Gondor, or Esquire of Rohan, is attached to a hero, that hero's controller has earned that boon.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Traits
property.value: Nazgûl. Captain.

property.name: Text
property.value: Immune to player card effects. Cannot be optionally engaged or take damage. Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, discard cards from the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Add the discarded enemy to the staging area.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Traits
property.value: Nazgûl. Sorcerer.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Only the engaged player can declare attackers against The Witch-king.
Forced: At the beginning of the envounter phase, The Witch-king engages the first player. Then, it makes an immediate attack.

card.name: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Rulesheet Card 1

property.name: Text
property.value: Phantom: During the "determine combat damage" step of an attack made by an enemy with Phantom, if any damage would be dealt by the attack, it is cancelled and the defending player raises his threat by an equal amount instead.

alternate.name: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Passing of the Grey Company

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Rulesheet Card 2

property.value: The Siege of Gondor

card.name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Rulesheet Card 1

property.name: Text
property.value: Assault: Progress cannot be placed on the quest stage by player card effects or by questing successfully. However, progress can still be placed on the active location as normal. When the players quest unsuccessfully, each player does not raise his threat. Instead, the players must deal X damage to Minas Tirith. X is the amount by which the total threat in the staging area was greater than the total willpower of each character committed to the quest.

alternate.name: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields

property.value: The Battle of the Pelennor Fields
